TopicTitle: K.J.P - Kollaboration of Joolian science - station/base/colonization [update re-post]

Articles.Content:
K.J.P. Kollaboration of Joolian Science Pardon the uncapitalized S*

Joolian Space Station/Base/Data collection collaboration. - Want to join?

This conglomerate is partially theorized from
this
post by Captain Sierra.

Purpose: To collect data/explore every monolith, feature, and characteristic of every Joolian moon and at the same time, colonize them (I.E. make bases and stations).

Google doc

Builders:

1. Avera9eJoe

2. Baberbot

3. Cantab

4. Captain Sierra

5. JebKerboom

6. Monopropellant

7. Super

8.

Mods:

- Kethane - To add something else entertaining to this project .

- Near Future Propulsion - to add extra parts and solar arrays (group voted to add it).

Changes to persistence:

- You cannot quick save or load. - This is why it is hardcore.

- All parts are unlocked but no data collected. - I've unlocked all parts so we can still build with them BUT there is no data on anything collected. Think of this save as sandbox but you can still collect data .

- When .35 comes out I will add science reports back into save! If this project is still around when .35 comes around I will add all science reports and stations, and do my best to add the bases (probably loading them in orbit and landing them with kethane).

10 people max so whoever signs up first will get pick.

Thanks for reading!

Later.

Edited May 21, 2014 by Avera9eJoe
Added Monopropellant

Project lead rules:

The way this collaborative build works everyone builds BUT all in the same save file. The persistence will be kept updated by everyone in a google doc along with current projects as well as an archive of data collected. Each person in rotation will get 3 days in order of sign up to build and launch whatever mission they chosen to a LKO orbit of 250km. Everything will be launched to Jool in a staggered mission after each member rotation. Make it or miss it. What you want to build is up to you as long as it is in Jool's SOI.

All ships can have a max part count of 300 when fully deployed/set (shouldn't get too close to this).

I hope to get a few people who want to do this! Really though, the sooner you sign up the sooner you get to launch.

What does everyone say about adding Near Future Propulsion? The pole has one yes and one no.

Edited April 25, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

Having looked over what the mod offers, I don't think we really need it, hence voted no. The main focus seems to be high Isp, which I don't think we really need for getting about the Jool system (though that said some of the moon-to-moon transfers have higher delta-Vs than I'd initially guessed). Still, if we have a good Kethane infrastructure in place, we shouldn't be hurting for fuel right?

Of course there are the space station parts too which might be nice.

Having looked over what the mod offers, I don't think we really need it, hence voted no...Of course there are the space station parts too which might be nice.

I haven't used it before and no we shouldn't be hurting for fuel. I'd like to add it purely for the solar panels xD I think they're cool. They'd add a more interesting add to stations I think. I completely agree with your opposing points though.

IMPORTANT NOTE: If someone designs a flag that we all like, we can all download and use it as default. In the mean time I'll be using retro.

Since there are several threads of this sort now, we've had to make a policy decision so that they will be handled consistently. From now on, if you're working on a joint project which doesn't involve offering craft files to non-members (because those belong in Rocket Builders), the thread should go here, in Forum Games. Please feel free to continue the thread/project in this new home.
